cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the northern Leeward Islands and Bahamas, then curving toward Cuba and the Florida peninsula/Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida or the Florida Keys

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches are confined to the northern Leeward Islands, Turks and Caicos, southeastern Bahamas, Hispaniola and Cuba—none yet for Florida.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings extend across the northern Leeward Islands, U.S./British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico—none yet for Florida.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Bahamas, Cuba, and the Florida peninsula/Gulf Coast (including west-central Florida).
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (34–63 kt) are possible at the port late Sunday with a 27 % cumulative probability; stronger 50 kt winds carry a 7 % chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore winds over Tampa Bay could push water levels above 3 ft, producing coastal flooding around Port Manatee late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible as Irma’s outer rain-bands sweep northward, creating flooding risk on port facilities and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and large breaking waves will hinder vessel traffic, while possible tornadoes in rain-bands could add localized damage.
